svcsubproc.title: General Procedures for Cab Removal
svcsubproc.para: The removal of the cab from chassis can be performed provided an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture are available. Removal procedures may vary for various models depending on the type of equipment and accessories.

note.para: Refer to the correct sections in the Master Service Manual for the component being removed and replaced.

step1.para: The following steps may be used as a guide.
Block wheels of truck and engage parking brake.
Tilt or remove hood.
Disconnect battery ground cable.
Drain cooling system and disconnect heater hose.
Disconnect steering shaft at gear.
Disconnect accelerator linkage and cruise control, if so equipped.
Disconnect electrical connections and ground wire.
Disconnect clutch linkage.
Disconnect brake system (air or hydraulic).

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

step1.para: Disconnect air conditioning lines (if so equipped). Refer to GROUP 16 - CAB in the Master Service Manual for the proper procedure.

warning.para: Refrigerant must be recovered from the air conditioning system before any components of the system are removed or replaced. Removing components while pressure is in the system will cause personal injury or death.
Always use approved refrigerant recycling equipment when working with R-134a. Federal and state laws require that refrigerant be recovered and recycled to help protect the environment.

Do not vent refrigerant into the atmosphere. The use of R-12 is a worldwide environmental concern. Because of the absence of chlorine in the molecular structure of R-134a, the use of R-134a refrigerant will not have any harmful effects on the ozone layer of the atmosphere. Because there is not enough evidence to determine the " greenhouse " effect of R-134a, recycling of R-134a is recommended. Effective November 1995, recovery and recycling of R-134a will be required by law.

step1.para: Remove shift lever from transmission.
Detach exhaust system from cab if system is vertical type.
Detach any other connections between the cab and frame, if required.
Install cab lifting fixture. Make sure fixture is padded to prevent damage to cab.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing the cab from the chassis. Pad the lifting fixture to prevent damage to the cab assembly.

step1.para: Partially lift cab so cab weight will be supported on lifting fixture.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab with Low Mount Front Cab Mounting and Low Mount Rear Cab Mounting for 4100, 4200, 4300 and 4400 Standard Cab and Extended Cab Models
Cab with Low Mount Front Cab Mounting for 4100, 4200, 4300 and 4400 Standard Cab and Extended Cab Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 126 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove the hex flanged nut (Item 1) and remove cab mount safety retainer (Item 2) from under cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3), driver side shown. Save hex flanged nut and cab mount safety retainer for installation.
Pull hex flanged bolt (Item 4) out of front cab mounting bracket (Item 5), driver side shown. Save hex flanged bolt for installation.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab mounting hardware.

figure.caption: Figure 126. Low Mount Front Cab Mounting for 4100, 4200, 4300 and 4400 Standard Cab and Extended Cab Models

svcsubproc.title: Cab with Low Mount Rear Cab Mounting for 4100, 4200, 4300 and 4400 Standard Cab and Extended Cab Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 127 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove hex flanged nut (Item 1) and remove rear cab rebound isolator (Item 2) from under rear cab chassis crossmember (Item 3). Repeat procedure to remove the other hex flanged nut (Item 1) and rear cab rebound isolator (Item 2).

The two carriage bolts (Item 4) are secured in place at the bottom of the cab underbody sill (Item 5) which is part of the cab floor with retaining clips (Item 6). The carriage bolts will remain with cab underbody sill and cab floor when cab is lifted off the chassis.

figure.caption: Figure 127. Low Mount Rear Cab Mounting for 4100, 4200, 4300 and 4400 Standard Cab and Extended Cab Models

caution.para: Inspect all cab to frame attaching points to be sure they are disconnected or damage can result.

step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, carefully lift cab from chassis. If removing cab from overhead crane, set it on a suitable surface to protect painted surfaces.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Low Mount Front Cab Mounting Isolators for 4100, 4200, 4300 and 4400 Standard Cab and Extended Cab before January 2003
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 126
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the chassis, if it is necessary to replace the front cab mounting isolator (Item 6), driver side shown. Remove as follows.

Remove two hex flanged nuts (Item 7) from two hex flanged bolts (Item 8) and remove both hex flanged bolts. Remove front cab mounting isolator (Item 6) from cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3), driver side shown. Save front cab mounting isolator, hex flanged nuts and hex flanged bolts for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab mounting isolator.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Low Mount Rear Cab Carriage Bolts and Compression Isolators for 4100, 4200, 4300 and 4400 Standard Cab and Extended Cab Models before January 2003
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 127
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the chassis, the rear cab compression isolators (Item 7) can be lifted off the cab chassis crossmember (Item 3). Save rear cab compression isolators for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

The two carriage bolts (Item 4) are secured in place at the bottom of the cab underbody sill (Item 5) which is part of the cab floor with retaining clips (Item 6). The carriage bolts will remain with cab underbody sill and cab floor when cab is lifted off the cab chassis crossmember (Item 3).

If it is necessary to replace the two carriage bolts (Item 4), thread retaining clips (Item 6) off the two carriage bolts. From inside the cab, lift the rear of the floor mat at the rear cab panel below the rear window and pull the two carriage bolts out of cab underbody sill (Item 5) and cab floor.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab with Low Mount Front Cab Mounting for all Crew Cabs and 4100, 4200, 4300 and 4400 Standard Cab and Extended Cab Models after January 2003 and Low Mount Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for all Crew Cab Models
Cab with Low Mount Front Cab Mounting for all Crew Cabs and 4100, 4200, 4300 and 4400 Standard Cab and Extended Cab Models after January 2003
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 128 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove the hex flanged nut (Item 1) from the threaded stud (Item 2) of the cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3) sticking through the front cab mounting bracket (Item 4), driver side shown. Save hex flanged nut for installation.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab mounting hardware.

figure.caption: Figure 128. Low Mount Front Cab Mounting for all Crew Cabs and 4100, 4200, 4300 and 4400 Standard Cab and Extended Cab Models after January 2003

svcsubproc.title: Cab with Low Mount Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for all Crew Cab Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 129 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two hex flanged nuts (Item 1) from the two carriage bolts (Item 2) under the top plate of the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3).

The two carriage bolts (Item 2) are secured in place to the bottom of the cab underbody sill (Item 4) which is part of the cab floor with retaining clips (Item 5). The carriage bolts will remain with cab underbody sill and cab floor when cab is lifted off the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3).

figure.caption: Figure 129. Low Mount Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for all Crew Cab Models

caution.para: Inspect all cab to frame attaching points to be sure they are disconnected or damage can result.

step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, carefully lift cab from chassis. If removing cab from overhead crane, set it on a suitable surface to protect painted surfaces.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Low Mount Rear Cab Air Suspension for all Crew Cab Models
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 129
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3), if it is necessary to remove the cab air suspension assembly to replace it, follow steps below.

If it is necessary to replace the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3), remove four hex flanged nuts (Item 6) from the four hex flanged bolts (Item 7). Remove the four hex flanged bolts from the mounting holes in the rear cab air suspension assembly.
Disconnect the air line connection to the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3), remove rear cab air suspension assembly from the frame rail crossmember (Item 8).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Low Mount Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting Carriage Bolts for all Crew Cab Models
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 129
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3). The two carriage bolts (Item 2) are secured to the cab underbody sill (Item 4) which is part of the cab floor with retaining clips (Item 5). The carriage bolts will remain with cab underbody sill and cab floor when cab is lifted off the rear cab air suspension assembly.

If it is necessary to replace the two carriage bolts (Item 2), thread retaining clips (Item 5) off the two carriage bolts. From inside the cab, lift the rear of the floor mat at the rear cab panel below the rear window and pull the two carriage bolts out of cab underbody sill (Item 4) and cab floor.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab with Mid High Front Cab Mounting and Mid High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 4400 Model for City Tractor Applications
Cab with Mid High Front Cab Mounting and Mid High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 4400 Model for City Tractor Applications
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 130 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove the hex flanged nut (Item 1) from the threaded stud (Item 2) of the cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3) sticking through the front cab mounting bracket (Item 4), driver side shown. Save hex flanged nut for installation.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab mounting hardware.

figure.caption: Figure 130. Mid High Front Cab Mounting for 4400 Model for City Tractor Applications

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 131 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two hex flanged nuts (Item 1) from the two carriage bolts (Item 2) under the top plate of the rear air suspension assembly (Item 3).

The two carriage bolts (Item 2) are secured to the cab underbody sill (Item 4) with cab mount retaining clips (Item 5). The carriage bolts will remain with cab underbody sill when cab is lifted off the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3).

figure.caption: Figure 131. Mid High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 4400 Model for City Tractor Applications

caution.para: Inspect all cab to frame attaching points to be sure they are disconnected or damage can result.

step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, carefully lift cab from chassis. If removing cab from overhead crane, set it on a suitable surface to protect painted surfaces.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Mid High Mount Rear Cab Air Suspension for 4400 Model for City Tractor Applications
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 131
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3), if it is necessary to remove the cab air suspension assembly to replace it, follow steps below.

If it is necessary to replace the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3), remove four hex flanged nuts (Item 6) from the four hex flanged bolts (Item 7). Remove the four hex flanged bolts from the mounting holes in the rear cab air suspension assembly.
Disconnect the air line connection to the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3), remove rear cab air suspension assembly from the frame rail crossmember (Item 8).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Mid High Mount Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting Carriage Bolts for 4400 Model for City Tractor Applications
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 131
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3). The two carriage bolts (Item 2) are secured to the cab underbody sill (Item 4) which is part of the cab floor with retaining clips (Item 5). The carriage bolts will remain with cab underbody sill and cab floor when cab is lifted off the rear cab air suspension assembly.

If it is necessary to replace the two carriage bolts (Item 2), thread retaining clips (Item 5) off the two carriage bolts. From inside the cab, lift the rear of the floor mat at the rear cab panel below the rear window and pull the two carriage bolts out of cab underbody sill (Item 4) and cab floor.
